TextJPN: 刑事一課のフロアに入り、藤田慎吾は吹き出す汗をぬぐいながら、自分の席に戻った。
TextENG: Shingo Fujita wiped the sweat from his brow while entering the First Investigation Division floor, then returned to his desk.

TextJPN: 「おつかれーっす。ただいま帰りま、@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3002.――うおッ？！」
TextENG: ``Nice to see you. I'm back.@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3002. ...Whoa?!``

TextJPN: そして、そのすぐ斜め前の窓際にある南井次長席の机にふと顔を向けて、…文字通り『ぎょっ？』と目を見開く。
TextENG: Then he turned to face Assistant Director Minai's desk, positioned diagonally from his desk by the window... only to widen his eyes in surprise.

TextJPN: そこには、赤、青、黄色、と色とりどりの丸い包みが１０、…いや２０、…いやいやそれ以上の数がこんもりと山になって、うず高く積み上げられていたのだ。
TextENG: He noticed colorful red, blue, and yellow wrappers piled high on the desk. There were ten... no, twenty... no, more than that stacked there.

TextJPN: 「な、なに、食ってんですか…？」
TextENG: ``Wh-what are you eating...?``

TextJPN: 「ハンバーガーよ。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3055.見てわかんない？」
TextENG: ``Hamburgers.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3055. Can't you tell?``

TextJPN: 「い、いや…、俺が言ってるのは物じゃなくて、量…」
TextENG: ``N-no... I'm not talking about what it is. I'm concerned by the quantity...``

TextJPN: あまりのハンバーガーの量に食い気よりも吐き気を催して、藤田は視線をそらす。
TextENG: Fujita looked away, feeling nauseous just thinking about eating so many hamburgers.

TextJPN: …と、その先にあったゴミ箱には、くしゃくしゃに丸められたハンバーガーの包みがあふれんばかりに詰め込まれているのを見て、さらに唖然となった。
TextENG: ...But he was even more stunned when he saw the trash can next to her overflowing with crumpled hamburger wrappers.

TextJPN: まさか、…これ全部、次長席に座るこの人がひとりで食べたってことなんだろうか？
TextENG: No way... Could this person sitting alone have eaten all of these?

TextJPN: 「あぐ、…ふひひゃふん。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3057.ひょっひは、ひょんひゃひゃんひ？」
TextENG: ``Ah... Fuhiyahun.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3057. Hoh, hyonhyahahnhi?``

TextJPN: 「…せめて食ってから言ってください」
TextENG: ``...Please finish eating before you speak.``

TextJPN: 「むっ…」
巴はやおら机の上のカップを手に取り、突きさしたストローを咥えてちゅうぅ、と勢いよく吸い込む。…おいおい、飲み物まで甘ったるいシェイクかよ。
TextENG: Tomoe abruptly grabbed the cup from the top of her desk, held the straw to her mouth and vigorously inhaled. ...Wait, a milkshake? Seriously? Even her beverage is junk food?

TextJPN: 「ふうっ…、一息ついた～」
TextENG: ``Haah... Time to take a breather~.``

TextJPN: 「…『一息』つくまでにいくら食べたんですか、南井さん。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3007.失礼を重々承知の上で言わせていただきますが、…よく太りませんね？@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3008.　不思議を通り越して、むしろ不気味ですよ」
TextENG: ``...How much were you able to eat without taking a breather, Minai-san?@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3007. With all due respect... aren't you worried about getting fat?@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3008. It goes beyond mysterious and straight into creepy.``

TextJPN: 「うっさいわね。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3061.肉体労働にはエネルギーが必要なのよ。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3062.そして使いすぎた頭脳の回復には、糖分を大量に摂取しないと。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3063.…なんか文句あるの？」
TextENG: ``Give it a rest.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3061. I need energy for all the physical activity I do.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3062. And it takes a lot of sugar to get your brain back to full capability after overworking it.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3063. ...Got a problem with that?``

TextJPN: 「いや、ないですけどね…」
TextENG: ``No, it's not that, but...``

TextJPN: にしても限度がある、と言いたくなるのを、藤田は辛うじて思いとどまった。
TextENG: Fujita barely abstained from saying ``You still have limits.``

TextJPN: …この、とても同い年とは思えないほど童顔の女警部を上司に仰いでから、早や半年が過ぎた。
TextENG: ...Nearly half a year had passed since he started working for this Chief Inspector, and he still found it almost impossible to believe this jovial woman was the same age as him.

TextJPN: 彼女は、この垣内署の山沖署長が直々に人脈を駆使してまで呼んできた、いわゆる『準キャリア組』のエリートだった。
TextENG: She was an elite member of the so-called ``Associate Career Class`` that was personally assembled by Chief Yamaoki, the Kakiuchi Station chief of police.

TextJPN: （とはいえ最初の頃は、順風満帆とはとても言えなかったよなぁ…）
TextENG: (However, those early days were hardly smooth sailing...)

TextJPN: どこの組織にでもある常識に漏れず、この署にも派閥というものが存在する。
TextENG: Word gets around in any kind of organization, and this station had already developed its own factions.

TextJPN: そのため配属当初、署長派と（勝手に）決め付けられた巴は副署長派のやっかみと妨害を受けて、『次長』という課長よりも上役だが、ラインとしての権限を持たない名誉職にまつりあげられてしまったのだ。
TextENG: For that reason, Tomoe was (arbitrarily) branded as a member of the Chief's faction and had to deal with the deputy chief's faction's envy. So Tomoe was given the honorary title of ``Assistant Director.``

TextJPN: …よって、藤田の本来の上司にあたるのは、実は刑事一課の山村課長であったりする。
TextENG: ...As a result, Fujita's boss on paper was actually the section chief of the First Investigation Division, Yamamura.

TextJPN: そんな巴のことを最初は彼も、他の刑事たちも気の毒とは思いつつ、彼女がキャリア持ちの若い女性だという先入観から興味本位に『お手並み拝見』と冷ややかに見ていたものだ。
TextENG: At first, he and the other detectives looked down on Tomoe based on their preconceived prejudice against a woman with a career, and coldly watched her while giving her ``Show me what you've got`` looks.

TextJPN: （普通なら怒るか、不貞腐れるかだろうな。…でも、彼女は違った）
TextENG: (A normal person would get angry or sullen. ...But she was different.)

TextJPN: 着任して早々、巴は男顔負けの血気盛んな行動力と明敏な洞察力を発揮して、迷宮入り直前の難事件を解決してしまった。
TextENG: As soon as she arrived, Tomoe exhibited intelligent insights and a will to take action, and was able to solve a difficult case just before it went unsolved.

TextJPN: そして、それに驕ることなく様々な現場に足を運び、昼夜を徹して労を惜しまずに働き続け、事件解決に真っ向から取り組んでいったのだ。
TextENG: And, she diligently traveled across various crime scenes, toiling tirelessly day and night, working incidents from inception to resolution.

TextJPN: そんな、純粋なほどのひたむきさに圧倒され、すっかり感化された山村課長はじめ刑事一課の刑事たちは、いまや彼女のことを名実の『ボス』と認めている。もちろん、藤田もその一人だった。
TextENG: All of the First Investigation Division, including section chief Yamamura, were completely overwhelmed by her dedication, and they came to admit she had earned the title of ``boss.`` Of course, Fujita was one of them.

TextJPN: それだけに、…結構本気で尊敬しているだけに、@kこの大食い癖さえなければ巴は、人前以上の容姿と快活な性格であまたの色男たちをはべらす才媛でいられたであろうことが非常に悔やまれて仕方がなかった…。
TextENG: For that reason... they'd grown to respect her.@k He deeply regretted that were it not for her extreme eating habits, a talented woman with her good looks and lively personality could have the most handsome of men at her beck and call...

TextJPN: 「そんなことより、そっちの捜査はどう？@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3065.　畠山一馬の家族の様子は？」
TextENG: ``Anyway, how is your investigation going?@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3065. How is Kazuma Hatakeyama's family doing?``

TextJPN: 「とりあえず、息子夫婦には早退してもらいまして。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3013.色々と任意で聞き込みをしましたが、…収穫は、ゼロでした。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3014.完全に貝でしたよ」
TextENG: ``For now, the son and his wife have left early.@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3013. They voluntarily answered to questioning, but... I didn't get any leads.@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3014. They completely clammed up.``

TextJPN: 「貝、ねぇ…。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3067.前に会ったときは、雛見沢のこととかも結構話してくれたんだけど」
TextENG: ``Clams, huh...?@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3067. When I spoke with them before, they had a lot to say about Hinamizawa, though.``

TextJPN: 「やはり、祟りを恐れているようでしたね。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3016.畠山一馬の豹変ぶりが当人たちには、相当なショックだったようです」
TextENG: ``It seems they must be afraid of the curse now.@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3016. Kazuma Hatakeyama's sudden change must have been a considerable shock to them.``

TextJPN: 「そうよね。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3069.…さすがに当事者ともなれば、前のように迷信だって笑えないわよね」
TextENG: ``Indeed.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3069. ...It's hard to laugh off superstitions like you used to once you become directly connected to an incident.``

TextJPN: 巴はそう言って、ポテトをぱくりと口に放り込んだ。
TextENG: After saying that, Tomoe tossed a potato chip into her mouth.

TextJPN: …公由　夏美の証言通り、雛見沢の出身者でも『オヤシロさまの祟り』を信奉しているのは老人たちがほとんどで、@k中年層から下はほとんど笑い飛ばすか、せいぜい道徳的なうすい敬虔しか持っていなかった。
TextENG: ...According to Natsumi Kimiyoshi, it's mostly the elderly who believe in ``Oyashiro-sama's curse,`` even in Hinamizawa.@k But the middle-aged and younger members of the population are far less devout, and find the notion laughable.

TextJPN: 息子夫婦が一馬への捜査協力に同意してくれたのも、おそらく『祟り』に対する畏怖の念が低かったからだ。
TextENG: Kazuma's son and his wife were probably not afraid of the ``curse,`` which is why they agreed to cooperate with the investigation.

TextJPN: それでも、…以後はそういうわけにはいかないだろう。
TextENG: Nevertheless... that probably won't be the case in the future.

TextJPN: 「ひょっとしたら、その発端が警察にあるんじゃないかって、こちらを恨んでいることだって考えられるでしょうね…」
TextENG: ``Perhaps they developed a grudge against us, thinking we're to blame for driving Kazuma into causing that incident...``

TextJPN: 「そんな…。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3018.そんなこと言い出したら、介護福祉センターに入居させたことがそもそもの始まりじゃないですか。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3019.警察を逆恨みするのは、筋違いだと思いますが？」
TextENG: ``No way...@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3018. If they're going to say that, can't you say it began when they sent him to the care and welfare center?@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3019. Doesn't it seem illogical for them to develop resentment toward the police instead?``

TextJPN: 「そんなこと、当人たちだってわかっているわよ。…おそらくね。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3072.でも、認めたくないのよ。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3073.自分たちのせいで、畠山一馬を死に追いやったんじゃないか、…なんてことは」
TextENG: ``In all likelihood... they probably know that too.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3072. But they don't want to admit it.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3073. Admit that it was their fault. That their actions drove Kazuma Hatakeyama... to his death.``

TextJPN: 一馬の息子である畠山正雄氏は、第一印象からして人の良い熟年男性だった。その妻の芳子氏も世話好きな、近所でも評判の主婦だという。
TextENG: Based on first impressions, Kazuma's son Masao Hatakeyama seemed like a good natured middle-aged man. His wife Yoshiko also seemed kind. She had a reputation within the neighborhood as a good housewife.

TextJPN: そして二人とも、一馬のことを非常に気遣っていたようで、昨年末に長年の連れ添いを失った彼に同居を申し出たのも、息子よりむしろ妻の方だったとのことだ。
TextENG: And both of them seemed to be very concerned about Kazuma. In fact, last year, when he lost his wife of many years, it was actually Yoshiko who offered him a place to stay with them.

TextJPN: それだけに、…人並み以上の優しさを持つ者なら、今回の一件は耐え難い衝撃だったはずだ。
TextENG: That's why... this incident had to have been unbearably shocking for those kindhearted people.

TextJPN: 「…それにしても。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3021.だとしたらどうして、数ヶ月もたたないうちにセンターへ入居させたんでしょう。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3022.一緒に住んでいて、何か問題でもあったんでしょうか？」
TextENG: ``...But still.@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3021. If that's the case, then why did they have him sent to the center just a few months after he moved in?@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3022. Did they have problems living together or something?``

TextJPN: 「介護士の話だとね、…奥さんを失ったショックで落ち込んで、自分の殻に閉じこもるようになったそうなの。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3075.足が弱くなって、救急車で運ばれたことがあってからは、…余計にね」
TextENG: ``According to the caregivers... he grew depressed from the shock of losing his wife, and he shut himself in.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3075. In that time, his legs atrophied and he had to be taken by an ambulance once... It became too much to bear.``

TextJPN: 「息子夫婦や、孫たちが話しかけても黙りこくって、ダメだったみたい。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3077.だから、同世代の人たちが集まる環境ならあるいは、と考えたそうよ。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3078.それに、奥さんがパート勤めから正社員に昇格したこともあって、やむなくの選択だったらしいわ」
TextENG: ``He remained silent even when his son, daughter-in-law, and grandchildren tried talking to him. He seemed like a lost cause.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3077. So they thought it might be better for him to be in an environment where he could be around other people his own age.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3078. Plus, Yoshiko was promoted from her part-time job to a full-time position around that time, so the decision became unavoidable.``

TextJPN: 正雄氏は元の雛見沢に戻すことも考えたそうだが、…今のままでは可哀想だと、芳子氏が反対したらしい。
TextENG: Masao apparently considered returning him to Hinamizawa, but... Yoshiko thought that would be a poor choice in her father-in-law's current state.

TextJPN: だから一馬が元気になってから、改めて同居か帰郷かを家族みんなで相談するんだと、巴は近所の親しい主婦から聞かされた……。
TextENG: Tomoe heard from one of their neighbors that the family had planned on talking to Kazuma about living with them again or returning to Hinamizawa after he became healthy.

TextJPN: 「……なんか、やりきれないですね」
TextENG: ``...It sounds unbearable.``

TextJPN: 「そうね。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3080.相手の幸せのためにやってきたことが、逆に不幸にさせてしまったのだとしたら、@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3081.…優しさって、一体なんなのかしら」
TextENG: ``Yes.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3080. If an action meant to make someone happy only ended up making them miserable instead...@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3081. ...Then what precisely is kindness?``

TextJPN: 藤田はその問いに答えられず、黙って嘆息する。巴もしばらく口をつぐんでいたが、空になったポテトの箱をくしゃっ、と丸めて捨てると、顔を上げて藤田に向き直った。
TextENG: Unable to find an answer, Fujita quietly sighed. Tomoe kept her mouth closed for a while, but crushed the empty bag of potato chips into a ball and threw it in the trash, then turned to face Fujita.

TextJPN: 「とりあえず、お疲れさま。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3083.ごめんね、私のわがままにつき合わせちゃって」
TextENG: ``Anyway, that's enough for today.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3083. Sorry to make you go along with my own selfish wishes.``

TextJPN: 「あ、いえこのくらい。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3026.…南井さんは、この後どうしますか？@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3027.　雛見沢のことをまだ調べるつもりなら、俺も一緒に付き合いますが」
TextENG: ``Ah, no, it's nothing.@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3026. ...Minai-san, what are you going to do after this?@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3027. If you're still planning to investigate Hinamizawa, I'm willing to go with you.``

TextJPN: 「そうね……」
巴は首をめぐらせて、背後の窓から外の景色に目を向ける。日よけのブラインドで隙間越しにしか見えなかったが、建物の影には夜のネオンがちかちかと色鮮やかに灯っていた。
TextENG: Tomoe turned to face the scenery outside the window. Although it was only visible through a small gap in the blinds, the evening lights were shimmering in the shadow of the building.

TextJPN: 「…行方不明になった大石さんの手がかりにでもなれば、と思ったんだけど、どうやらこれ以上の見入りはなさそうね。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3086.あの子とも、これで最後にするって約束しちゃったし」
TextENG: ``...I was hoping to get some more clues about Ooishi-san's whereabouts, but there are apparently no other leads.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3086. And I promised that girl that this would be the end of it.``

TextJPN: 「あの、南井さん。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3029.本当に、『オヤシロさまの祟り』を調べることが、…その大石って刑事さんの消息を確かめることになるんですか？@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3030.　なんか、その理屈がわからないっていうか…」
TextENG: ``Uh, Minai-san.@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3029. Do you really believe we can uncover that Ooishi guy's whereabouts by investigating ``Oyashiro-sama's curse``?@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3030. I don't understand your reasoning...``

TextJPN: 「――すみません。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3032.難癖をつけるわけじゃないんです、ただ…」
TextENG: ``...I'm sorry.@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3032. I'm not trying to criticize you, it's just...``

TextJPN: 「いいの、藤田くんの言いたいことはわかってるつもりだから。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3089.私もね、正直言って半信半疑なの。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3090.でも――」
TextENG: ``It's fine, Fujita-kun, I understand what you're getting at.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3089. To be honest, I'm not certain myself.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3090. However...``

TextJPN: …あの、大石からの電話。
TextENG: ...That phone call from Ooishi.

TextJPN: 『オヤシロさまの祟り』で殺された被害者の遺体について調べてほしいと頼まれた数時間後に、…雛見沢村でガス災害が起こり、そして大石は、……行方不明となった。
TextENG: Shortly after they were asked to investigate the body of a victim who was killed by ``Oyashiro-sama's curse``... the gas disaster occurred in Hinamizawa village. And then...... Ooishi went missing.

TextJPN: ただの偶然かもしれない。…でも、それにしては話が、あまりにもできすぎていた。
TextENG: It could just be a coincidence. ...But that was looking increasingly unlikely.

TextJPN: だからその真相を探ることで、彼が突き止めようとしたことの一端を知ることができるのでは、と考えたのだけど…。
TextENG: So she thought that by looking into the truth of the matter, she could understand what Ooishi was trying to accomplish...

TextJPN: 「まぁ、…とりあえずこの一件は、まずここで置きましょう。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3092.他にも仕事がないわけじゃないし、@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3093.…これ以上藤田くんを連れ回して奥さんに浮気相手って疑われるのも、いろんな意味で心外だし、ね♪」
TextENG: ``Well... we should probably set this case aside for the time being.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3092. It's not like you don't have more work, and besides...@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3093. if I monopolize your time any longer, Fujita-kun, you wife will think you're cheating on her, and that would be bad for you in all sorts of ways, won't it?♪``

TextJPN: 「み、南井さんしつこいですよ！@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3034.　あの件では俺も祐子も、平謝りに謝ったじゃないですか？！」
TextENG: ``M-Minai-san, don't be nosy!@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3034. Yuko and I both apologized for that, didn't we?!``

TextJPN: 「あっはははは！　いいでしょ、これくらいは。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3095.寂しい独り身のちょっとした憂さ晴らしなんだからさ～？@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3096.　困ったときの伝家の宝刀として、生涯私の家宝としておきます」
TextENG: ``Aahahahaha! I guess this is fine then.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3095. But don't you think it's a little sad leaving a lonely woman on her own like this~?@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3096. Your family is your treasure, so you should keep it close for life.``

TextJPN: 「お…鬼や、あんたはっ！」
TextENG: ``Y... you're a demon!``

TextJPN: 「くっくっくっ…！@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3098.　それはともかく、どう？　藤田くんも一緒に？@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3099.　おなか空いてるでしょ」
TextENG: ``Mwahaha...!@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3098. Anyway, how about it, Fujita-kun? Do you want to head out?@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3099. I'm feeling a little hungry.``

TextJPN: 「結構です」
TextENG: ``No thanks.``

TextJPN: 「…即答ね。@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3101.私の勧める食事が食べられないっての？」
TextENG: ``...That was a quick reply.@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3101. Can you not handle the meals I recommend?``

TextJPN: 「ハンバーガーは好きですけどね。@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3038.…さすがにそれだけの量目の前にして、食指は動きませんっての」
TextENG: ``I like hamburgers.@k@vS20/31/VTT_fujita3038. ...But with that huge mass of flesh before my eyes, I can't bring myself to move a finger.``

TextJPN: 「なぁによ～！@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3103.　人を大食いみたいに――、？！」
TextENG: ``Hey!@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3103. You make it sound like cannibalism...!``

TextJPN: その時。
TextENG: And just then.

TextJPN: フロア内に大音量の警報が鳴り響いて、緩んでいた場の空気が一瞬にして張り詰める。続いてスピーカーから、雑音混じりにアナウンスの声が聞こえてきた。
TextENG: A loud siren echoed across the floor, and the air instantly grew tense. Then the voice of an announcer came in through the speakers, mixed with a lot of background noise.

TextJPN: 『県警本部より、垣内署の刑事課へ通達。@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3002.くり返す。県警本部より、垣内署の刑事課へ通達。@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3003.――殺人事件発生。@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3004.容疑者の所在は不明。@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3005.事件現場は――』
TextENG: ``This is prefectural police headquarters, paging the Kakiuchi Station criminal investigation division.@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3002. I repeat. This is prefectural police headquarters, paging the Kakiuchi Station criminal investigation division.@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3003. ...A murder has been reported.@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3004. The suspect's whereabouts are unknown.@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3005. The crime scene is...``

TextJPN: 読み上げられた住所名をメモに手早く書きとめてから、巴はすぐ横の壁にある地図ボードに駆け寄る。…が、はたと気づいてその横の山村課長に目を向けた。
TextENG: After quickly writing down the name and address from the announcement, Tomoe immediately rushed to the map board on the side wall. ...But then she noticed Section Chief Yamamura was also beside it.

TextJPN: 山村は気にするな、と言わんばかりに肩をすくめながら、微笑して頷く。定年を目前にしている好々爺の彼は、最近だとほとんどの職務、そして指令権限を巴に任せていた。
TextENG: Yamamura shrugged his shoulders, then smiled and nodded to tell her not to mind him. He was a good-natured man close to retirement age, so recently he had left most of his duties and command authority to Tomoe.

TextJPN: 巴はその気遣いに目礼で答えると、出動名簿を流し読みする。そして振り返り、すでに席を立ち上がって指令を待つ刑事たちに向き直って言った。
TextENG: Tomoe responded with a nod while sifting through the dispatch roster. Then she turned back toward the detectives standing and waiting for her orders, and spoke.

TextJPN: 「高屋敷さんと花田くん、５号車で出動！　鑑識対応よろしく！@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3106.山上さんと安藤さんは、交通課と連携して４丁目交差点の交通整理と左折道路の封鎖を！」
TextENG: ``Takayashiki-san and Hanada-kun, head out in the #5 car! You're on forensics support!@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3106. Yamagami-san and Andou-san, work with the transportation division to direct traffic at the 4th district intersection and block the left turn!``

TextJPN: 「反対側の３丁目交差点には、中山くんと嶋さんで！@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3108.　それから藤田くんは、私と！　２号車表に回してきてっ！！」
TextENG: ``Nakayama-kun and Shima-san, handle the 3rd district intersection on the opposite side!@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3108. And Fujita-kun, you're with me! You're driving the #2 car!!``

TextJPN: 「「了解ッッ！！」」
「山村課長！@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3110.　状況次第では本店とつなぎます、その時はよろしくお願いします！」
TextENG: ``Section Chief Yamamura!@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3110. Depending on the circumstances, we may need to communicate with the head office, so if that happens I'd appreciate your cooperation!``

TextJPN: 「わかった。@k@vS20/00/VTT_yamamura3003.頼んだぞ！！」
TextENG: ``Understood.@k@vS20/00/VTT_yamamura3003. I'm depending on you!!``

TextJPN: 「はいっ！！@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3112.　それじゃみんな、出動ッッ！！！」
TextENG: ``Got it!!@k@vS20/28/VTT_tomoe3112. All right everyone, move out!!!``

TextJPN: 「「おおぉおぉっすッッ！！！」」
TextENG: ````Let's gooooooo!!!````

TextJPN: 巴の号令を受けて、いっせいに刑事たちは我先にとフロアを飛び出してゆく。
TextENG: Responding to Tomoe's command, all the detectives scrambled across the floor together.

TextJPN: ――しかし、続いてスピーカーから流れたアナウンスの内容に巴は廊下で立ち止まり、愕然とした思いで振り返った。
TextENG: ...However, Tomoe stopped and turned around in surprise when another announcement came pouring out of the speakers.

TextJPN: 『――県警本部第一機動捜査隊より、連絡あり。@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3007.容疑者は捜査員到着後、事件現場の家屋内にて自殺を図った模様。@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3008.意識は不明、所轄の刑事は至急救急車両および隊員の進路を確保されたし』
TextENG: ``...There's a message from the prefectural police headquarters' first Mobile Investigation Team.@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3007. After investigators arrived, it seems that the suspect tried to commit suicide at the crime scene.@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3008. The suspect is unconscious, but the investigators have cleared a path for emergency vehicles and crew.``

TextJPN: 『現場は一般家庭住宅。@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3010.被害者は容疑者の妻と子供二人で、いずれも死亡を確認。@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3011.容疑者の氏名は、――畠山正雄』
TextENG: ``The scene of the crime is the family's residence.@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3010. The victims are the suspect's wife and two children, all three confirmed deceased.@k@vS20/00/VTT_cent3011. The name of the suspect is...... Masao Hatakeyama.``

TextJPN: …そう。
TextENG: ...That's right.

TextJPN: まだ、事件は終わっていない。
TextENG: This incident still wasn't over.

TextJPN: それどころか、始まってもいなかったのだ。
TextENG: On the contrary, it was still only beginning.
